Job Title: Specialist, Manufacturing Automation

Location: West Point, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Description

The Specialist Manufacturing Automation Engineer in the West Point Digital Manufacturing Operations organization will be responsible for the manufacturing process automation systems in the Barrier Operations Formulation and Filling facility at the West Point, PA site.

General Responsibilities Include

Troubleshooting challenging equipment/automation issues and innovating to improve manufacturing performanceMaintaining the automation systems in compliance with cGMPs through the life cycle of the equipment (initial qualification through retirement). Providing support as a representative of an existing production team, providing technical assistance in fulfilling the automation requirements for the team. Reviewing automation documents, preventive maintenance, and SOPs to ensure compliance with GMP and safety.Developing and supporting corrective actions for investigations related to automation or IT systems.Using technical knowledge to assure the efficient operation of a variety of automated processing and information technology systems. Participating in audits and training programs in the area of responsibility.Providing on-floor support of manufacturing activities.Generating and implementing change controls to meet the needs of the facility.

Education Requirements

High School diploma or equivalent and 4+ years of relevant industry experience required.BS in Engineering, Computer Science or related field with 2+ years of relevant industry experience preferred

Skill Requirements

Strong technical writing capabilitiesExperience with navigating/troubleshooting Process Control systems, with preferred experience with the following: DeltaV DCS, Allen Bradly PLC, OPC, Siemens Step7, Modbus/Fieldbus/Profibus and other related technologies

Preferred Skills

System validation and other Quality management functions.Understanding and ability to apply regulatory/ compliance requirements relative to their roleNetworking, Virtual Machines, Database management and other general IT administration.

MSJR
